page.title: 02 Keith-natural environment
page.content: In this area the winters can be severe at times but in general are fairly mild.Summers are cool but are warmer than those of the higher ground to the south.Rainfall is on average about 1000mm per year.The open nature of the land exposes the region to winds except in places sheltered by surrounding hills.There is no strictly natural vegetation left.The vegetation consists of crops,rough grazing,forestry plantations and windbreaks with heather bracken on higher ground. The chief wild animals are roe deer,hares, rabbits,foxes,otter and wild mink.The man birds are mostly common species such as starlings,blackbirds,pigeons,crows and gulls but there are also some pheasant and grouse.The R.Isla contains trout,salmon and sea trout.
